Basically for flashy plays enticing you to ward hop behind a squishy and ult them into your team hitting tanks along the way, but its really not even a buff. Then he has a barely-buff passive update that just lets him get energy back a wee bit quicker.

Not gonna say he needed a buff but its super small, barely noticeable, why the hell is everyone making such a big deal out of it?
Riot adds %BonusHealthDamage to targets hit and then everyone loses their minds.

Problem is that its damage is reliant on the target kicked, not every individual hit. It punishes proper positioning, and having a tank on your team. If it just dealt individual %hp bonus hp, it would deal relatively the same damage to squishies and just a bit more to tanks (which is okay, since they'll be able to take it).

If you ask me it relies more on Improper positioning due to you having to be lined up, at the right angle with your tank.

It's like being grouped when facing champs like ziggs or malphite, where you have to take your fights in lanes or be screwed over

So... Standing behind your tank is "improper positioning" now? Especially with Lee in the picture, because if you take one Q you are flying back into the opposing team.

This is basically a win-win situation for Lee. If he can get to carries, they ged Insec'd. If he can't, he'll just use their tank for a 1000+ damage nuke.

According to the new buffs, yes it is.
It is now an addition to a mechanic that you should have been doing ever since lee came out, which was not being directly behind your tank.

Also Lee can be stopped during his Q, not like him landing Q= auto lose, Hi maokai, naut and thresh!

I understand having to play differently is very annoying but as I mentioned with previous examples ( ziggs and malphite) it is nothing new.

To be fair he was hovering around 46.3% win rate for a couple of patches according to champion.gg, which is pretty low. As of this patch it has actually decreased to 44.92% so far despite the fact that he got buffed, though that could be in part due to his increased play rate.

As of the time of this comment (stats from op.gg, filtered for last 7 days and ranked solo):
All - 45.21% win rate - 93,745 games.
Plat - 45.58% win rate - 18,176 games.
Diamond - 47.74% win rate, 6,196 games.
Master - 55.19% win rate, 270 games.

Note that the win rate for Master is the only place where his win rate passes 50%, and that the sample size is very small and therefore not very accurate. Filtering instead by last month shows that he has a 51.66% win rate over 962 games in Master. We'll be able to access more accurate data as time goes on but this is about the extent of what we can use at the moment.

I know that the Boards don't like Lee because of how long he has been a dominant pick, but come on. He needed some buffs.
He should've gotten his attack slow back instead of having a 45 sec CD, 1K damage AOE CC nuke.

I agree that he didn't need anymore power into his ult, but he did need some sort of buff. The attack speed slow, however, would be far stronger than the ult buff as it is far less situational and greatly improves his early game. I probably would've buffed his shield's amount or lowered its cooldown ever so slightly. He certainly doesn't need more damage. The main problem is that it's a little bit hard to buff him without making him overpowered because of his kit. Readding the attack speed slow, for example, would just cause him to dominate early game even harder while also giving him more late game power. Changing the shield on the other hand, which is usually maxed last, would have little effect on his early game while making him somewhat more durable in the late game.
